title: Corrections & Amplifications
description: Corrections & Amplifications for the edition of Oct. 25, 2023

title: FAA Finally Gets Permanent Leadership
description: The Senate confirmed Mike Whitaker to lead the air-safety regulator after a year and a half with temporary bosses.

title: Australia Shares Poised to Rise Ahead of Key Inflation Data
description: Australia’s S&P/ASX 200 looks set to rise at the open after strong earnings reports helped U.S. stocks finish higher.

title: The New Rise of Organized Shoplifting
description: Students discuss retail theft, criminal prosecution and low-trust public spaces.

title: Biden's Red-Line Moment With Iran
description: Blinken promises a swift and decisive response, but will Biden back it up?

title: Meanwhile, Trouble in the Pacific
description: A China-Philippines wreck shows Beijing’s increasingly risky military moves.

title: A Hamas Hostage's Work in Africa
description: Shoshan Haran launched Fair Planet to help farmers, including many Muslims, grow more food.

title: The Trumpian Tragedy of Jenna Ellis
description: Trump’s stolen election claims keep hurting everyone but himself.

title: Michael Cohen Testifies Against Trump in Civil Fraud Trial
description: The former president’s fixer-turned-foe claimed his former boss ordered him to inflate asset values.

title: Women Rule the Pop Charts. One Record Exec Understands Why Better Than Most.
description: John Janick’s artist-friendly ethos is a draw for fostering early-career acts like Olivia Rodrigo and Billie Eilish.

title: Shut Up, the TED Talk People Explained
description: The company invited a lecture by Coleman Hughes and then buried it after employees complained.

title: The Antitrust Case Against Google Was a Republican Project
description: Biden regulators have gone overboard, but this case isn’t a good example.

title: Notable & Quotable: Privilege
description: ‘You can’t fire seven hundred Harvard students. It would be a scandal.’

title: 'Life on Our Planet' Review: On Netflix, Natural History as You've Never Seen It
description: Morgan Freeman narrates this eight-part documentary, which covers billions of years on Earth and features marvelous digital effects and even more impressive nature photography.

title: U.S. Lawmakers Point to Reports of Forced Labor in China's Seafood Industry
description: The lawmakers cited a journalism group’s reports that laborers from the country’s Xinjiang region are being forced to work in processing facilities elsewhere.

title: 'Secrets of the Dead: Eiffel's Race to the Top' Review: Paris's Peak on PBS
description: The long-running history series revisits the construction of the Eiffel Tower and the battle of tastes it represented.

title: Speedy Fish Tostadas That Taste Like a Mexican Vacation
description: Super-simple but full of tangy, smoky flavors, these clever trout tostadas are finger food at its most satisfying

title: The Tax Rule Change That Is Threatening Businesses' Survival
description: A tax code change that impacts how companies account for research and development costs is walloping businesses of all sizes.

title: Microsoft Earnings Growth Picks Up on Stronger-Than-Expected Cloud Demand
description: The company’s partnership with OpenAI has helped power new aritificial-intelligence businesses.

title: Democrats Won't Let Crisis Go to Waste
description: With conflict overseas, the White House sees yet another opportunity to increase domestic spending.

title: Britney Spears Settles the Score in Blockbuster Memoir
description: Coming out of a 13-year conservatorship, the pop star is finally talking about everything from her father to Justin Timberlake to #FreeBritney in her new book, ‘The Woman in Me.’

title: Stocks Gain After Major Companies Beat Wall Street Expectations
description: Coca-Cola, General Electric and 3M boosted their outlooks, helping lift U.S. share benchmarks.

title: Talks Set to Resume in St. Lawrence Seaway Strike
description: The walkout by Canadian workers that began over the weekend is the second this year to affect the country’s shipping networks.

title: Google Ad Growth Accelerates as Economic Outlook Improves
description: Parent company Alphabet reports an 11% increase in revenue , driven by strength in search-engine ads.

title: Hollywood's A-List Bribe for Peace
description: George Clooney and friends offer big bucks to stop a suicidal actors strike.

title: Snap Returns to Revenue Growth After 2 Quarters Of Declining Sales
description: The company behind the popular social-media app Snapchat is seeing improvements in ad spending, but cautions Israel Hamas war could temper its recovery.

title: AI May Soon Weigh In on Regulation
description: How will agencies like the FCC deal with computer-generated public comments?

title: 'Fierce Ambition' Review: Maggie Higgins at the Front
description: As a young war correspondent, she defied the skepticism of her male colleagues. Her drive left many struggling to catch up.

title: Lying Down (Wednesday Crossword, October 25)
An Unrealistic Exit Route for President Biden
description: How does he decisively defeat Russia, Iran, Hamas or Hezbollah before the 2024 election?

title: Hamas Took More Than 200 Hostages From Israel. Here's What to Know.
description: Militants from the Gaza Strip abducted civilians and soldiers in the attack on Israel.

title: Irony in Judge Chutkan's Gag Order on Trump
description: The Justice Department should be ordered to not release photos of the seized classified documents that will make their way to jurors.

title: School Choice Lowers Cost of a Top-Notch Education
description: Texas Republicans should embrace a tried-and-true solution.

title: Would We Love Cars If We Had More Trains?
description: I spent three hours a day creeping along in a hot metal box on my commute.

title: Jewish Students, Stand Tall
description: If you lived in Israel, you would be facing rockets—and worse.

title: Breaking up a Political Duopoly
description: Open primaries and ranked-choice voting could dramatically thin the ranks of the most extreme, least productive Republicans and Democrats.

title: Pro Take: Tech Leaders Launch Effort to Support Critical Israeli Tech Startups
description: A group of venture capital professionals are launching an effort to connect early-stage startups in Israel with investors around the world who are willing to provide them with emergency capital.

title: Firm Retention Summary: Soft Surroundings
description: This is a summary of a request from Soft Surroundings to hire Katten Muchin Rosenman as counsel, filed Oct. 4 with the U.S. Bankruptcy Court in Houston.

title: Finland Suspects Chinese Ship's Anchor Damaged Gas Pipeline
description: Finland said a Chinese ship’s anchor had likely caused a mysterious rupture of an undersea gas pipeline in the Baltic Sea earlier this month.

title: Louisiana 'Superfog' Blamed for at Least Seven Deaths in Car Pileups
description: A combination of fog and smoke known as “super fog” caused a series of car pileups on Interstate 55 near New Orleans, killing at least seven people and injuring 25.

title: Helicopter Ambulance Operator Air Methods To Shed Debt in Chapter 11
description: Private-equity backed helicopter ambulance business Air Methods has filed for bankruptcy, planning to cut its debt load by $1.7 billion amid struggles with inflation, reimbursement delays and severe weather.

title: Your Periodic Reminder That Evil Is Real
description: Hamas’s atrocities force us to confront the concept, though it doesn’t take long for equivocation to begin.

title: $8.99 Cereal Could Rock the Globe
description: High prices in U.S. stores will play an outsize role in 2024’s presidential election.

title: Cruise's Driverless-Car Permits Suspended in California
description: The California Department of Motor Vehicles suspended Cruise’s autonomous vehicle deployment and driverless testing permits, citing safety concerns.

title: Alaska Airlines Pilot Charged After Allegedly Trying to Disable Engines During Flight
description: Joseph David Emerson was off duty at the time of the incident and faces a federal criminal charge of interfering with flight crew members.

title: ECB to Keep Interest Rates Steady for Several Quarters
description: Barring a shock in energy prices, “we expect the European Central Bank to stay put at the current levels for several quarters,” Antonio Villarroya, head of G-10 macro and fixed-income strategy research at Santander CIB, says.

title: Despite Israel-Hamas War, It's (Nearly) Business as Usual at Saudi Investment Forum
description: JPMorgan, Goldman Sachs and Blackstone bosses were there, a sign of the pull the kingdom and Mohammed bin Salman have on the finance world.

title: Iranian-Backed Militias Mount New Wave of Attacks
description: Tehran appears to have ended an undeclared six-month truce as the U.S. supports Israel.

title: New RSV Drug Has Limited Supply, CDC Says
description: Cases of the common but potentially deadly respiratory virus are on the rise.

title: More »
description: Meta is being sued by more than 40 states. It is being accused of intentionally building its products with addictive features that harm young users.

title: China Increases Bond Issuance to Help Its Economy
description: Beijing is taking steps to support infrastructure projects and raised its budget-deficit target outside the regular legislative session for the first time in more than a decade.

title: States Sue Meta Alleging Harm to Young People on Instagram, Facebook
description: A group of more than 40 attorneys general are filing lawsuits alleging that Meta Platforms built products with addictive features that harm young users.

title: Spotify Hit All the Right Notes
description: The music streamer’s strong subscriber and margin growth following a price hike affirms its position in the industry’s value chain.

title: Kering Sales Miss Forecasts Amid Luxury Industry Slowdown
description: The owner of Gucci and Yves Saint Laurent posted revenue of €4.46 billion in the third quarter, below analysts’ forecasts of €4.52 billion.

title: Georgia's Six-Week Abortion Ban Upheld
description: Georgia’s highest court on Tuesday upheld a law banning abortion after about six weeks of pregnancy, a decision that will keep abortion access significantly constrained throughout most of the South.

title: GOP Senators Demand Changes to Biden's Ukraine, Israel, Border Package
description: The administration has requested $106 billion in emergency funds to aid allies and bolster the U.S. immigration system.

title: Bob Odenkirk Isn't Letting His Past Repeat Itself
description: Ahead of the children’s book he wrote with his daughter, the ‘Nobody’ and ‘Better Call Saul’ star discusses his father’s alcoholism, parenting and why he prefers dramatic acting.

title: UAW Calls Strike on One of GM's Most-Profitable Factories
description: About 5,000 unionized workers walked out of GM’s SUV plant in Arlington, Texas, on Tuesday morning.

title: 'Killers of the Flower Moon' Puts New Indigenous Stars on the Map
description: Specialists in Native American casting are increasingly being used to cast a host of projects that center their stories.

title: Natural Gas Rise Slightly Amid Mild Weather Forecasts
description: Natural gas prices continued to edge higher after seemingly finding a bottom on Friday, as weather forecasts remain mild.

title: Trump Lawyer Jenna Ellis Pleads Guilty in Georgia Racketeering Case
description: Ellis became the third legal adviser to the former president to plead guilty in the election-interference case .

title: Meta's Threads Still Lags Behind Musk's X, but Platform Is Growing Again
description: Threads power users say the atmosphere has improved even as they await key features.

title: Roe v. Wade Is Gone, but Abortions Are On the Rise
description: New state bans have done little so far to deter women from obtaining abortions, according to new data.

title: Live Markets: Bitcoin Tops $34,000
description: A stabilization in the 10-year Treasury yield lifted stocks amid a busy slate of earnings from companies including Google parent Alphabet and Microsoft.

title: The Morning Risk Report
description: Justice Department and a Russian billionaire battle over seized superyacht, and Tesla confirms probe into executive perks and related-party deals. Also, WPP fires an employee detained in China, launches an investigation into bribery charges.

title: Banks Face Shake-Up of Low-Income Lending Rules
description: Top U.S. banking regulators plan to complete a revamp of anti-redlining rules for the era of online banking.

title: Dispatch From Israel's Northern Border as Hezbollah Tensions Mount
description: Israeli authorities announced the evacuation of Kiryat Shmona as the country prepares for the possibility of a two-front war: battling Hamas to the south as well as its ally Hezbollah in Lebanon to the north.

title: Apple Risks Getting Caught in Taiwan Tensions With iPhone Supplier Probes
description: China’s investigations into Taiwanese supplier Foxconn come as its billionaire founder pursues a bid for the Taiwanese presidency.

title: Bank of Canada Expected to Keep Rates Steady on Dour Growth Outlook
description: Confidence among businesses and consumers is eroding, analysts say, evidence that higher rates are cooling activity.

title: More Men Are Taking Care of Their Aging Parents. The Learning Curve Is Steep.
description: Sons who are caregivers say they often feel unqualified and ill-equipped.

title: Victor Wembanyama Is Here. The NBA's Scorers Should Be Afraid.
description: The San Antonio Spurs’ super-rookie debuts Wednesday night against the Dallas Mavericks, and he’ll be at his most captivating when he doesn’t have the ball.

title: China Strips Missing Defense Minister of Government Posts
description: Li Shangfu’s absence has fueled speculation about his fate and prompted Western officials to raise concerns about China’s increasingly opaque governance under Xi and the ruling Communist Party.

title: Trump Files New Arguments for Dismissal of Election-Interference Charges
description: The former president’s lawyers said the indictment violates his free-speech rights and is politically motivated.

title: Plateau in ECB Interest Rates, Higher Coupons Make Bonds Attractive Again, Vontobel Says
description: The European Central Bank is likely finished with raising interest rates in the current cycle, making government and corporate bonds attractive again, Vontobel told Dow Jones Newswires in an interview.

title: GE Raises Forecasts, Sets Power Spinoff for Spring 2024
description: General Electric’s plan to shed its power business is the final step in a breakup of the industrial giant and will leave GE’s aerospace unit as a standalone business. Shares rose more than 5% premarket.

title: A Niche Real-Estate Corner Goes Mainstream in the Digital Age
description: Data centers that house the Internet and AI computing are growing at a record rate but raise concerns over environmental impact.

title: House Republicans to Pick New Speaker Nominee After Weeks of False Starts
description: They hope to end a three-week-old political crisis in a party vote Tuesday morning and then to move to the floor to elect a new speaker later in the day.

title: This $5 Billion Biotech Home Run Took Less Than a Year
description: In a deal that now feels like a biotech version of ‘Moneyball,’ Roivant announced it was selling an asset that only 11 months ago it got for free from Pfizer.

title: Basic Materials Roundup: Market Talk
description: Find insight on Indonesia coal stocks, Petronas Chemicals and more in the latest Market Talks covering the Basic Materials sector.

title: Financial Services Roundup: Market Talk
description: Find insight on Barclays, Kasikornbank and more in the latest Market Talks covering the Financial Services sector.

title: KKR's Chip Play Will Win Big in Japan
description: The private-equity giant has scored a win in Japan and with a chip price rebound probably around the corner, their timing looks impeccable. Investors should consider going along for the ride.

title: Tech, Media & Telecom Roundup: Market Talk
description: Find insight on Orange, Chinese tech companies and more in the latest Market Talks covering the Tech, Media & Telecom sector.

title: Dispatch From Israel's Northern Border as Hezbollah Tensions Mount
description: Israeli authorities announced the evacuation of Kiryat Shmona as the country prepares for the possibility of a two-front war: battling Hamas in the Gaza Strip to the south and Hezbollah in Lebanon to the north.

title: Auto & Transport Roundup: Market Talk
description: Find insight on Asia Aviation, MISC and more in the latest Market Talks covering the Auto & Transport sector.

title: World Leaders Press Israel to Minimize Civilian Casualties in Gaza
description: French President Emmanuel Macron traveled to Israel in a show of support as world leaders urge Israel to rethink how it goes about achieving its war objectives.

title: Healthcare Investor OrbiMed Advisors Raises $4.3 Billion
description: OrbiMed Advisors has raised more than $4.3 billion to invest in healthcare, giving the investment firm significant firepower at a time when many startups are struggling to secure funding.

title: Energy & Utilities Roundup: Market Talk
description: Find insight on Viva Energy, Crescent Energy and more in the latest Market Talks covering the Energy & Utilities sector.

title: Health Care Roundup: Market Talk
description: Find insight on Novartis, ResMed and more in the latest Market Talks covering the Health Care sector.

title: U.S. State Senator Arrested in Hong Kong After Carrying Gun Onto Flight
description: Jeff Wilson, who has been released on bail, said that he didn’t realize the firearm was in his bag and that baggage screeners in the U.S. hadn’t detected it.

title: GM Reports $3.1 Billion Profit, Despite UAW Strike Hit
description: The Detroit automaker is now losing about $200 million a week from factory walkouts.

title: China Shut the Door on Two Online Brokers. Then Their Stocks Boomed.
description: Futu and Up Fintech were dealt a heavy blow when Chinese regulators blocked investors from opening accounts with the China-focused brokers. So why have their U.S.-listed stocks taken off?

title: 3M Boosts Year-End Earnings Guidance
description: The conglomerate said efforts to improve performance and control costs are bearing fruit.

title: How an Academic Uncovered One of the Biggest Museum Heists of All Time
Mitsubishi Motors to End Car Production in China
description: Mitsubishi Motors plans to end production of cars in China in response to sluggish sales amid stiff competition.

title: The Texas Rangers Finally Have a Chance to Wake Up From a Nightmare
description: The Rangers beat Houston in a wild American League Championship Series, giving them a chance to overcome the painful memory of a 2011 World Series meltdown—and win their first championship.

title: Why the U.S. Can't Quit Tipping
description: You’re being asked to tip more and in more places today. If you’re annoyed, you’re not alone. WSJ explains why tipping culture has grown, and why the U.S. probably isn’t getting rid of it anytime soon.

title: Automakers and Suppliers Spar Over Car Data
description: Car-parts makers, rental companies, repair shops and insurers are battling with manufacturers over a coming European regulation that would allow more companies to profit from car data, divvying up valuable information about drivers habits and car functions.

title: Elite Universities Face Donor Revolt Over Mideast Conflict
description: Some wealthy alums say the response to the Hamas attacks was the final straw after years of growing disenchantment.

title: Here's a Bill That Might Be Lower Than Last Year's
description: A natural-gas surplus is expected to reduce heating bills for nearly half of U.S. households.

title: How High Bond Yields Could Chill the Hot U.S. Economy
description: The sharp run-up in long term yields comes as the economy faces several potential challenges.

title: Is It Time To Worry About Banks' Business Lending?
description: The market’s focus on offices and credit cards may miss what’s more important for many regional lenders.

title: New York State Hires First Chief Customer Experience Officer
description: Tonya Webster was tapped for the senior position, created to develop more streamlined and secure digital services for the state.

title: Seal It With a Handshake and a…Cold Plunge? The Hot New Way to Do Business.
description: Mixing business with ice baths or showers can feel ‘like being shot by a BB gun.’ It can also be an invigorating way to network and bond with co-workers, some executives say.

title: Thanks to Big Data, Landlords Know How to Squeeze the Most Out of Renters
description: Two firms face allegations that rent-pricing systems facilitate collusion among some big apartment owners.

title: Trump's Incendiary Rhetoric Costs Him in Courtroom, Risks Votes in 2024
description: While many Republicans might welcome the former president’s tough talk, it could repel some voters in the middle, particularly women, who rejected him in 2020.

title: Eurozone Activity Drops Sharply
description: The Flash Composite Output Index for the eurozone fell to 46.5 in October, hitting its lowest level in just under three years, with the reading undershooting economists’ forecasts.

title: RBA Governor Sounds Hawkish Warning in First Speech
description: Reserve Bank of Australia Gov. Michele Bullock sounded a hawkish warning to markets, saying the central bank won’t have any patience if coming inflation data shows a material rise in price pressures.

title: Barclays Trims U.K. Net Interest Margin View
description: Barclays said it expects net interest margin for the U.K. of 3.05%-3.1% in 2023, as it posted lower-than-expected third-quarter income growth.

title: Green Steel Is Coming. Europe Is Leading the Charge Thanks to New Carbon Taxes.
description: By 2030, the continent is expected to be home to nearly 50 low-carbon steel projects, while just two are planned in the U.S.

title: Puma Backs Outlook Despite Weaker Profits
description: Puma confirmed its 2023 guidance even though its underlying earnings fell by 8.3% in the third quarter, hit by currency effects.

title: UK Jobless Rate Holds Steady
description: The unemployment rate was unchanged in the three months to August at 4.2%, a further signal of the U.K.’s stubbornly robust labor market that could continue to cause problems for the BOE.

title: Bond Yields Expected to Head Lower Over Next Six Months
description: Bond yields are expected to decline over the next six months as high borrowing costs weigh on the economy, J O Hambro Capital Management said.

title: No Recovery Seen in German Consumer Mood This Year
description: Germany’s forward-looking consumer-sentiment index forecast confidence to fall to minus 28.1 in November, weakening for a third consecutive month, with GfK and NIM saying “hopes of a recovery…this year must finally be laid to rest.”

title: UniCredit Upgrades Guidance After Third-Quarter Beat
description: UniCredit raised its 2023 outlook for net interest income and revenue, after its third-quarter results came in above forecast, and said it expected to pay shareholders at least €6.5 billion for 2024.

title: Orange Keeps Outlook After Solid Third Quarter
description: Orange confirmed its 2023 guidance after it reported earnings for the third quarter that edged consensus expectations.

title: Novartis Lifts Guidance Again
description: Novartis said it now expects core profit in the year to grow by a percentage in the mid to high teens range after it reported a 21% rise in core earnings in the third quarter, boosted by strong sale of key drugs.

title: Energy Shocks to Hasten Move to Renewables, IEA Says
description: Global demand for fossil fuels is likely to peak before the end of the decade, with mounting shocks to the global energy system caused by geopolitical uncertainty hastening the move to renewable energy, the IEA said.

title: Chevron said it would buy Hess in an all-stock deal valued at $53 billion in the second major oil-industry tie-up this month, after Exxon Mobil's deal to acquire Pioneer Natural Resources.
description: Chevron said it would buy Hess in an all-stock deal valued at $53 billion in the second major oil-industry tie-up this month, after Exxon Mobil’s deal to acquire Pioneer Natural Resources.

title: The Corporate Retreat From Hong Kong Is Accelerating
description: The commercial hub’s ties to mainland China, which global companies once considered an asset, have become a liability.
